name: Gradle
description: Build using a Gradle wrapper script
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: wrapperScript
inputs.label: Gradle Wrapper
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the `Gradle Wrapper script`.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory to run Gradle build in. Defaults to repository root.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to VSO/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit Test results produced by the Gradle build to VSO/TFS. Each test result file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in VSO/TFS.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all xml files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the Test Run.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class Files Directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of directories containing class files, archive files(jar, war etc.). Directories and archives are searched recursively for class files. Code coverage is reported for class files present in the directories. For example, classes1/Tests,classes2/Tests2. Refer https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/jacoco_plugin.html.

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class Inclusion/Exclusion Filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example, +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*. Refer https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/jacoco_plugin.html.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of JDK.
